quotes.quote: Sunsets, like childhood, are viewed with wonder not just because they are beautiful but because they are fleeting.
Sunsets are so beautiful that they almost seem as if we were looking through the gates of Heaven.
Every sunset brings the promise of a new dawn.
Sunset is a wonderful opportunity for us to appreciate all the great things the sun gives us!
Never waste any amount of time doing anything important when there is a sunset outside that you should be sitting under.
It is almost impossible to watch a sunset and not dream.
To watch a sunset is to connect with the Divine.
Keep looking up! I learn from the past, dream about the future and look up. There's nothing like a beautiful sunset to end a healthy day.
Twilight drops her curtain down, and pins it with a star.
There's a special quality to the loneliness of dusk, a melancholy more brooding even than the night's.
If I could lick the sunset, I'll bet it would taste like Neapolitan ice cream.
The strange thing about the sunset is that we actually don't want the sun to set, we want it to stay right on the horizon, not below it, not above it, just right on it!
At the end of the world the sunset is like a child smashing a pack of crayons into God's face.
The whisper of the dusk is night shedding its husk.
The sunset caught me, turned the brush to copper, set the clouds to one great roof of flame above the earth.
Beyond the sundown is tomorrow's wisdom, today is going to be long, long ago.
It was that hour of dusk when the streetlights and headlights come on but make little difference.
Evening is a time of real experimentation. You never kind of want to look the same way.
Enjoy the beauty of a sunset nature's farewell kiss for the night.
The sacred lamp of day / Now dipt in western clouds his parting ray.
Nature is painting for us, day after day, pictures of infinite beauty if only we have the eyes to see them.

Soon it got dusk, a grapy dusk, a purple dusk over tangerine groves and long melon fields; the sun the color of pressed grapes, slashed with burgundy red, the fields the color of love and Spanish mysteries.
It seems there is more interest in sunsets than sunrises. Perhaps because innately we fear the dark.
Sunsets in themselves are generally superior to sunrises; but with the sunset we appreciate images drawn from departed peace and faded glory.

People are just as wonderful as sunsets if you let them be. When I look at a sunset, I don't find myself saying,  'Soften the orange a bit on the right hand corner.' I don't try to control a sunset. I watch with awe as it unfolds.
Don't forget:beautiful sunsets need cloudy skies.
Down sank the great red sun, and in golden, glimmering vapors Veiled the light of his face, like the Prophet descending from Sinai.
Bursts of gold on lavender melting into saffron. It's the time of day when the sky looks like it has been spray-painted by a graffiti artist.
One day, I watched the sun setting forty-four times......You know...when one is so terribly sad, one loves sunsets.
The redness has seeped from the day and night was arranging herself around us. Cooling things down, staining and dyeing the evening purple and blue black.
